checkExpiredToken.log:
HTB token expired, please update it.
Bot is being stopped.

Follow this steps to correctly set me again:
	1. Go to https://app.hackthebox.com/ and log in
	2. Click on your profile user (top right)
	3. Click 'Account Settings'
	4. Find 'App Tokens' menu
	5. Click on 'Manage Apps Tokens' and delete the expired one
	6. Click on 'Create App Token'
	7. Copy the new token
	8. Replace the old token new one in the '.env' file
	9. In 'index.js' update the 'HTBtokenExpiration' object with the new expiration date
	10. Execute 'git add . && git commit -m "updated HTB token expiration date" && git push && npm version patch && npm publish && npm start'
checkExpiredToken.toAdmin: Hey ‚úåüèª, I have bad news for you. HTB Token is expired. ‚ö†Ô∏è This means I can't work properly anymore and I am going to stop myself. Follow this steps to correctly set me again: 1. Go to https://app.hackthebox.com/ and log in 2. Click on your profile user (top right) 3. Click 'Account Settings' 4. Find 'App Tokens' menu 5. Click on 'Manage Apps Tokens' and delete the expired one 6. Click on 'Create App Token' 7. Copy the new token 8. Replace the old token new one in the '.env' file 9. In 'index.js' update the 'HTBtokenExpiration' object with the new expiration date 10. Execute 'git add . && git commit -m "updated HTB token expiration date" && git push && npm version patch && npm publish && npm start' That's it! You've replaced the token! üéâ
checkExpiredToken.toAdmin_1week: Hey ‚úåüèª, I have bad news for you. HTB Token is going to expire in 1 week. ‚ö†Ô∏è This means I will have to stop myself when that happens. Follow this steps to reset the token before I stop myself: 1. Go to https://app.hackthebox.com/ and log in 2. Click on your profile user (top right) 3. Click 'Account Settings' 4. Find 'App Tokens' menu 5. Click on 'Manage Apps Tokens' and delete the expired one 6. Click on 'Create App Token' 7. Copy the new token 8. Replace the old token new one in the '.env' file 9. In 'index.js' update the 'HTBtokenExpiration' object with the new expiration date 10. Stop the bot (Ctrl+c) 11. Execute 'git add . && git commit -m "updated HTB token expiration date" && git push && npm version patch && npm publish && npm start' That's it! You've replaced the token! üéâ
